Title(s): The Complaint of Christ to Man and Man’s Answer
Subjects: Christ, complaint of, to man; dialogues, Christ and man
_description: The Complaint of Christ to Man and Man’s Answer (stanza 10) — ten twelve-line stanzas with refrain, ‘Why art þou to þy frende vnkynde’

BodDou78.First Lines:
This is crystes owne complayntefro man to man þat he hathe
                    boȝte…
BodDou78.Last Lines:
…With sore wepynge we may say alaceþat euer we were to
                    oure frende vnkynde

CamTCC600.First Lines:
Þis is Crystes owen compleyntfrome man to manhim self he
                    seyþe til vs atteynt my lewed people what haue I wroughtþen
                    man þat art to me so seynt And I sofer þy lyf haue soughtTo
                    me þyne aunswere no thing þu peynt for why by cause I knowe
                    þee nought…
CamTCC600.Last Lines:
…And Mary mylde swettest of face prey for wee beon fer
                    byhyndeffor weepe we may and sey allas By cause we beo toure lord
                    vnkynde
CamTCC600.Attributed Title:
Takeþe heed of þis hooly balade conteyned vpon hooly writte made
                    by a maystre of diuynite by duocyoun (p. 233, bottom); þe complaynt of
                    Cryst frome man to man (RT)
